src.visualization package¶

Submodules¶

src.visualization.vis_data module¶

src.visualization.vis_data.add_ln_trend_line(series, ax, color='royalblue', linewidth=1, linestyle='dashed')[source]¶

Fit linear line between the index of df and the data and add linear trend line to the plot.

Parameters

  • series – series to lienar fit

  • ax – plt axis object

  • color – color of the line

  • linewidth – width of the line

  • linestyle – linestyle

Returns: np.array, np.array

numpy array of the linear trend line x and y

src.visualization.vis_data.cal_sea_yr(df, agg='mean', start_month='-12-01', end_month='-04-30')[source]¶

Calculate the season year average.

Parameters

  • df – data to calculate the season average. Must have datetime index

  • agg – aggeration method (ex ‘mean’)

  • start_month – starting month of the season

  • end_month – ending month of the season

Returns: pd.DataFrame

season yearly average

  • agg (optional) – aggegration method for pollution

Parameters

  • city_name – city name for title

  • color_list – a list of color to use. If None, use the

  • ylim – yaxis range

  • filename (optional) – filename to save data

src.visualization.vis_data.plot_dendogram(data: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, cols=None, front_size=16, filename=None)[source]¶

Plot hierarchical relationship between features in the data.

Parameters

  • data – dataframe from dataset.data

  • cols (optional) – columns to use for making the dendogram. If None, use the columns of the data dataFrame

  • front_size (optional) – plot front size [default:None]

  • filename (optional) – if not None, save plot as filename[default:None]

src.visualization.vis_data.plot_hour_avg(df, col, ax, color='blue')[source]¶

Plot average hourly behavior. Must have datetime index.

Parameters

  • df – dataframe containing the column to plot

  • col – name of the columns to plot

  • ax – axis to plot the data on

  • color (optional) – color of the plot

src.visualization.vis_data.plot_season_aqi(poll_df, roll_dict, pollutant, filename=None, aqi_line=True)[source]¶

Plot average seasonal AQI value of a pollutant, and identify the high months.

Parameters

  • poll_df – raw pollution data

  • roll_dict – rolling dictionary

  • pollutant – pollutant value

  • filename (optional) – filename to save

  • aqi_line (optional) – if True, show horizontal aqi line

src.visualization.vis_data.plot_season_avg(poll_df, pollutant, ax, plot_error=True, roll=True, agg='max', color='blue', linestyle='solid', linewidth=2)[source]¶

Plot the average by date of year. Good for looking seasonal pattern.

Parameters

  • poll_df – dataframe for plotting the data. Must have datetime index

  • pollutant – columns to plot

  • ax – axis object to plot

  • plot_error – if True, use sns.lineplot to show the error

  • roll – if True, calculate the rolling average or use daily average

  • agg – either ‘max’ or ‘mean’

src.visualization.vis_data.plot_yearly_ln(dataset, min_year=None, filename=None)[source]¶

Obtain yearly trends of PM pollutant data, number of hotspots and temperatures to compare their trends.

Parameters

  • dataset – dataset object with all data

  • filename (optional) – filename to save data

src.visualization.vis_data.poll_to_aqi(poll_df, roll_dict)[source]¶

Convert concentration pollution dataframe to aqi dataframe

Parameters

  • poll_df – pollution data

  • rolling_dict – rolling information for each pollutant

Returns: aqi dataframe

src.visualization.vis_model module¶

src.visualization.vis_model.plot_infer_season(poll_df, pollutant, sea_pred, color_zip, filename=None)[source]¶

Compare the actual and inference predicted data in seasonal format

Parameters

  • poll_df – pollution data

  • pollutant – pollutant to plot

  • sea_pred – inference data

  • color_zip – color and level indicating the AQI

  • filename – save filename

src.visualization.vis_model.plot_model_perf(dataset, model, split_list=[0.7, 0.3], xlim=[], to_save=True)[source]¶

Plot model performance over training and test data. - plot actual againt prediction for train and test set - take the daily average and plot actual again prediction for training and test set - return error of the training and test set as dataframe

Parameters

  • dataset – dataset object

  • model – fitted model

  • split_list (optional) – train/test spliting ratio[default:[0.7,0.3]]

  • xlim (optional) – if passed, use these value for xlim

  • filename (optional) – if not None, save the figure using the filename

Returns

actual, prediction of the training set (no averaging) test_pred_df: actual, prediction of the test set (no averaging)

Return type

trn_pred_df

src.visualization.vis_model.plot_sea_error(trn_error, sea_error, filename=None)[source]¶

Plase seasonal error the training data and the average value.

Parameters

  • trn_error – raw training error

  • sea_error – seasonal error used in the inference

  • filename – save filename

src.visualization.vis_model.plt_infer_actual(ytest_pred_df_avg, band_df, filename=None)[source]¶

Compare the actual and inference predicted data in timeseries format. :param ytest_pred_df_avg: actual data to plot :param band_df: inference data to plot with different quantiles :param filename: save filename
